<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fascinating Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=5147) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 255 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12)

</column>

---

When you Perform, compare your result to the Will DC of one observer. If you succeed, the target is [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) by you for 1 round. If the observer is in a situation that demands immediate attention, such as combat, you must critically succeed to fascinate it and the [Perform](/Actions.aspx?ID=2401) action gains the [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=631) trait. You must choose which creature you're trying to fascinate before you roll your check, and the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

If you're an expert in Performance, you can fascinate up to four observers; if you're a master, you can fascinate up to 10 observers; and if you're legendary, you can fascinate any number of observers at the same time.

<title level="2">Fascinating Performance leads to...</title>
[Focused Fascination](/Feats.aspx?ID=6131)
name: Fascinating Performance
